metadata.dc:author: Ruiz Garcia, Jesus
Leva Vallejo, Manuel
Lopez Beltran, Antonio
Regueiro Lopez, Juan Carlos
metadata.dc:description: BACKGROUND We describe a new case of incidental renal papillary carcinoma. We perform a bibliographic review. METHODS The papillary renal cell carcinoma is a variant of renal carcinoma. They classify in two subtypes that have relation with their prognosis. We presented one case of renal papillary carcinoma in a male of 76 years, play-acting as severe hydronephrosis. RESULTS We describe the findings and final pathological result associated with a synchronic metastasis in the ipsilateral ureter. CONCLUSIONS We describe the findings and final pathological result associated with a synchronic metastasis in the ipsilateral ureter.
metadata.dc:title: Hidronefrosis como c√°ncer papilar renal.
[Papillary renal carcinoma presenting as hydronephrosis].
